required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics of Atazanavir/Ritonavir in HIV-1 Infected Pregnant Women
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of the Pharmacokinetics of Atazanavir (ATV)/Ritonavir(RTV) Administered as Part of Highly Active Antiretroviral Therapy (HAART) in HIV-1 Infected Pregnant Women

brief_summary.textblock: To determine what dosing regimen of atazanavir (ATV) / ritonavir (RTV) produces adequate drug exposure during pregnancy compared to drug exposure in historical data in human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infected participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ATV Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) in One Dosing Interval
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: Cmax = maximum observed plasma concentration of atazanavir at specified time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean RTV Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) in One Dosing Interval
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: Cmax = maximum observed plasma concentration of ritonavir at specified time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ATV Area Under the Concentration Curve (AUC TAU)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: AUC = area under the concentration curve (AUC [TAU]) of atazanavir in one dosing interval from time zero to 24 hours.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean RTV Area Under the Concentration Curve (AUC TAU)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: AUC = area under the concentration curve (AUC [TAU]) of ritonavir in one dosing interval.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ATV Trough Plasma Concentration (Cmin) 24 Hours Following the Daily Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum at 24 hours following the daily dose.
primary_outcome.description: Cmin = plasma concentration 24 hours post dose of atazanavir at specified time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean RTV Trough Plasma Concentration (Cmin) 24 Hours Following the Daily Dose
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum at 24 hours following the daily dose.
primary_outcome.description: Cmin = plasma concentration 24 hours post dose of ritonavir at specified time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ATV Terminal Elimination Half Life (T 1/2)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: T 1/2 = terminal elimination half life of atazanavir at specified time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean RTV Terminal Elimination Half Life (T 1/2)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: T 1/2 = terminal elimination half life of ritonavir at specified time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ATV Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: Tmax = time to reach maximum observed plasma concentration of atazanavir at specified time points.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean RTV Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 12 to 28, Weeks 28 to 36, and 4-6 Weeks Postpartum
primary_outcome.description: Tmax = time to reach the maximum observed plasma concentration of ritonavir at specified time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maternal HIV Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Level on Day of Delivery
secondary_outcome.description: The maternal HIV RNA level is assessed by the Roche Amplicor® Ultrasensitive Assay Version 1.5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Change From Baseline to Day of Delivery in Maternal HIV RNA Level
secondary_outcome.description: The maternal HIV RNA level was determined at baseline and the day of delivery ± 2 days using VR-OC. The maternal HIV RNA level is assessed by the Roche Amplicor® Ultrasensitive Assay Version 1.5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean HIV RNA Level at Baseline
Median Change From Baseline to Day of Delivery in Maternal Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) Cell Count
secondary_outcome.description: The median CD4 cell count change from baseline was calculated for all treated mothers at the time of delivery ± 2 days. Maternal CD4 cell counts were assessed by the Roche Amplicor® Ultrasensitive Assay Version 1.5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean CD4 Cell Count at Baseline

secondary_outcome.description: The neonatal HIV-1 status are assessed by the Roche Amplicor HIV-1 DNA Assay Version 1.5 (Roche Molecular Systems).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During study period and 30 days post-study.
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE =any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Grade 2 to Grade 4 AEs and SAEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Study Period and 30 Days Post-Study.
secondary_outcome.description: AEs and SAEs considered possibly, probably, or certainly related to study treatment, were graded according to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 3.0 (Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death). Hyperbilirubinemia (Grade 1=1.1 to 1.5 upper limit of normal [ULN] [mild], Grade 2=1.6 to 2.5 ULN [moderate], Grade 3=2.6 to 5.0 ULN [severe], Grade 4= > 5.0 ULN [potentially life threatening]).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Study Period and 30 Days Post-Study.
secondary_outcome.description: SAEs were evaluated for all treated and untreated participants. An SAE was defined as an untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening (defined as an event in which the participant was at risk of death at the time of the event); might have caused death if it were more severe, required inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, an important medical event that required intervention to prevent serious outcomes.

SAEs were evaluated for all treated and untreated participants. An SAE was defined as an untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening (defined as an event in which the participant was at risk of death at the time of the event); might have caused death if it were more severe, required inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, an important medical event that required intervention to prevent serious outcomes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Atazanavir Maternal Plasma Concentration and Neonatal Cord Blood Concentration
secondary_outcome.description: Mean atazanavir maternal plasma concentration and neonatal cord blood concentration as measured at the time of delivery.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Birth (Day 1), Day 3, Day 5, and Day 7 of Life
secondary_outcome.description: Median infant total bilirubin level as measured at specified time points.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pregnancy Weeks 28 to Delivery at 3 Hours Postdose and 24 Hours Postdose, and Time of Delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Atazanavir Plasma Protein Binding Percentage measured at specified time points.

secondary_outcome.measure: Multicenter AIDS Cohort Study (MACS) Participant Adherence to Regimen and Drug Components for ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg Test Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Week 2, Pregnancy Weeks 20 to Weeks 28, Pregnancy Weeks 28 to Delivery, Week 2 Postpartum, Week 4 Postpartum
secondary_outcome.description: The MACS was administered to evaluate participant adherence to each drug and the adherence to the regimen. The MACS adherence questionnaire asks patients how many medication doses they missed during the previous day, 2 days, 3 days and 4 days. Drug-specific questions included adherence with dose and frequency. Adherence was defined as taking all doses and numbers of pills as prescribed for each medication. This strict adherence cut-off was based on the guidelines stating that anything less than excellent adherence may result in a virus breakthrough and development of resistance.

intervention.description: Capsules, tablets, Oral, initially ATV 300 mg + RTV 100 mg + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg, dose escalated to ATV 400 mg + RTV 100 mg + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg, ATV and RTV once daily, lamivudine (ZDV) / zidovudine (3TC) twice daily (BID), up to 36 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- HIV-infected pregnant women
- > 18 years of age
- Between week 12 and 32 gestation
- CD4 > 200 cells/mm³
- Treatment-naive with HIV RNA > 400 c/mL, on HAART with HIV RNA <50 c/mL, or previously treated with ATV (< 3 weeks) with HIV RNA>400 c/mL

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link: http://www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

clinical_study.keyword: HIV-1 infected pregnant women, either treatment naive or on ATV/RTV combined with ZDV/3TC

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Pregnant participants were enrolled at 6 sites: United States (2), South Africa (3), and Puerto Rico (1).
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of the 69 enrolled participants, 28 mothers were not treated. Failure to continue to meet enrollment criteria resulting in discontinuation in 24/28 participants and 4 were not treated: 1 poor/no compliance, 1 met exclusion criteria, 1 was ARV naive subject with HIV RNA < 400 c/mL, and 1 was unable to comply with study procedures.

group.title: Mother ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving atazanavir (ATV) / ritonavir (RTV) 300/100 mg once daily (QD) + lamivudine (ZDV) / zidovudine (3TC) 300/150 mg twice daily (BID) during the third trimester. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

group.title: Mother ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 400/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during the third trimester. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

group.title: Infants ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Infants born to mothers receiving treatment with ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg during the third trimester of pregnancy.

group.title: Infants ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Infants born to mothers receiving treatment with ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg during the third trimester of pregnancy.

participants_list.participants: Completion was defined as completing the study.
Completion was defined as completing the study.
Completion was defined as completing all follow up visits through 6 months.
Completion was defined as completing all follow up visits through 6 months.
All infants were followed. One mother withdrew consent pre-delivery and her infant was not followed.

group.title: Mother ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 300/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during the third trimester. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

group.title: Mother ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 400/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during the third trimester. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

Age

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
HIV RNA Distribution at Baseline
Infant Gestational Age at Delivery

outcome.title: Maternal HIV Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Level on Day of Delivery
outcome.description: The maternal HIV RNA level is assessed by the Roche Amplicor® Ultrasensitive Assay Version 1.5.
outcome.time_frame: Day of Delivery ± 2 Days
outcome.population: The analysis for the proportion of HIV RNA < 400 and < 50 c/mL at delivery is based on the Virologic Response - Observed Cases (VR-OC). VR-OC classifies subjects who remain on study therapy as responders according to a single HIV RNA measurement < 400 c/mL (or < 50 c/mL) closest to delivery and within delivery date ± 2 days.

group.title: Mothers ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 300/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during weeks 28 to 38 of pregnancy. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

group.title: Mothers ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 400/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during weeks 28 to 36 of pregnancy. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

measure.title: Maternal HIV Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Level on Day of Delivery
measure.description: The maternal HIV RNA level is assessed by the Roche Amplicor® Ultrasensitive Assay Version 1.5.
measure.population: The analysis for the proportion of HIV RNA < 400 and < 50 c/mL at delivery is based on the Virologic Response - Observed Cases (VR-OC). VR-OC classifies subjects who remain on study therapy as responders according to a single HIV RNA measurement < 400 c/mL (or < 50 c/mL) closest to delivery and within delivery date ± 2 days.

outcome.title: Median Change From Baseline to Day of Delivery in Maternal HIV RNA Level
outcome.description: The maternal HIV RNA level was determined at baseline and the day of delivery ± 2 days using VR-OC. The maternal HIV RNA level is assessed by the Roche Amplicor® Ultrasensitive Assay Version 1.5.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day of Delivery ± 2 Days
outcome.population: The median maternal HIV RNA Level Change From Baseline was calculated for all treated mothers at the time of delivery. The maternal HIV RNA level at delivery was determined as the closest to delivery and within a pre-defined visit window for delivery, which is delivery date ± 2 days.

group.title: Mother ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 300/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during the third trimester. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

group.title: Mother ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 400/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during the third trimester. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

measure.title: Median Change From Baseline to Day of Delivery in Maternal HIV RNA Level
measure.description: The maternal HIV RNA level was determined at baseline and the day of delivery ± 2 days using VR-OC. The maternal HIV RNA level is assessed by the Roche Amplicor® Ultrasensitive Assay Version 1.5.
measure.population: The median maternal HIV RNA Level Change From Baseline was calculated for all treated mothers at the time of delivery. The maternal HIV RNA level at delivery was determined as the closest to delivery and within a pre-defined visit window for delivery, which is delivery date ± 2 days.

outcome.title: Mean HIV RNA Level at Baseline
outcome.time_frame: Baseline
outcome.population: All treated participants.

group.title: Mothers ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg Third Trimester
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 300/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during weeks 28 to 36 of pregnancy. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

measure.population: All treated participants.

outcome.title: Median Change From Baseline to Day of Delivery in Maternal Cluster of Differentiation 4 (CD4) Cell Count
outcome.description: The median CD4 cell count change from baseline was calculated for all treated mothers at the time of delivery ± 2 days. Maternal CD4 cell counts were assessed by the Roche Amplicor® Ultrasensitive Assay Version 1.5.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Day of Delivery ± 2 Days
outcome.population: The median CD4 Cell Count Change From Baseline was calculated based on all treated mothers. The maternal CD4 cell count at delivery was determined as the closest to delivery and within a pre-defined visit window for delivery, which is delivery date ± 2 days.

group.title: Mother ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE =any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: During study period and 30 days post-study.
outcome.population: The number of SAEs is based on enrolled participants. Data were pooled from the ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg and ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg groups for all treated mothers and all infants.

group.title: All Treated Mothers
group.description: Data are pooled for mothers in the ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg and the ATV 400 mg / 100 mg groups.

group.title: All Infants
group.description: Data are pooled for infants in the ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg and the ATV 400 mg / 100 mg groups.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE =any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
measure.population: The number of SAEs is based on enrolled participants. Data were pooled from the ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg and ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg groups for all treated mothers and all infants.

class.title: Total AEs Leading to Discontinuation (n=41, n=40)

measurement_list.measurement: Prematurity causing discontinuation was considered an infant only AE/SAE and thus was not deemed appropriate for evaluation in the mothers only population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Grade 2 to Grade 4 AEs and SAEs
outcome.description: AEs and SAEs considered possibly, probably, or certainly related to study treatment, were graded according to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 3.0 (Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death). Hyperbilirubinemia (Grade 1=1.1 to 1.5 upper limit of normal [ULN] [mild], Grade 2=1.6 to 2.5 ULN [moderate], Grade 3=2.6 to 5.0 ULN [severe], Grade 4= > 5.0 ULN [potentially life threatening]).
outcome.time_frame: During Study Period and 30 Days Post-Study.
outcome.population: Data were pooled from the ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg and ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg groups for all treated mothers and all infants. The number of AEs and SAEs is based on enrolled participants.

group.title: All Treated Mothers
group.description: Data are pooled for mothers in the ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg and the ATV 400 mg / 100 mg groups.

group.title: All Infants
group.description: Data are pooled for infants in the ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg and the ATV 400 mg / 100 mg groups.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Grade 2 to Grade 4 AEs and SAEs
measure.description: AEs and SAEs considered possibly, probably, or certainly related to study treatment, were graded according to Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) Version 3.0 (Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death). Hyperbilirubinemia (Grade 1=1.1 to 1.5 upper limit of normal [ULN] [mild], Grade 2=1.6 to 2.5 ULN [moderate], Grade 3=2.6 to 5.0 ULN [severe], Grade 4= > 5.0 ULN [potentially life threatening]).
measure.population: Data were pooled from the ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg and ATV 400 mg / RTV 100 mg groups for all treated mothers and all infants. The number of AEs and SAEs is based on enrolled participants.

outcome.title: SAEs in Enrolled Mothers
outcome.description: SAEs were evaluated for all treated and untreated participants. An SAE was defined as an untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening (defined as an event in which the participant was at risk of death at the time of the event); might have caused death if it were more severe, required inpatient hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, an important medical event that required intervention to prevent serious outcomes.

outcome.population: Data were analyzed for all treated and untreated mothers.

group.title: Mothers ATV 300 mg / 100 mg Third Trimester
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 300/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during weeks 28 to 38 of pregnancy. outcome.title: Multicenter AIDS Cohort Study (MACS) Participant Adherence to Regimen and Drug Components for ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg Test Dose
outcome.description: The MACS was administered to evaluate participant adherence to each drug and the adherence to the regimen. The MACS adherence questionnaire asks patients how many medication doses they missed during the previous day, 2 days, 3 days and 4 days. Drug-specific questions included adherence with dose and frequency. Adherence was defined as taking all doses and numbers of pills as prescribed for each medication. This strict adherence cut-off was based on the guidelines stating that anything less than excellent adherence may result in a virus breakthrough and development of resistance.
outcome.time_frame: Study Week 2, Pregnancy Weeks 20 to Weeks 28, Pregnancy Weeks 28 to Delivery, Week 2 Postpartum, Week 4 Postpartum
outcome.population: All treated participants were included in this evaluation.

group.title: Mother ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg
group.description: Mothers receiving ATV/RTV 300/100 mg QD + ZDV/3TC 300/150 mg BID during the third trimester. Each dose of ATV/RTV (taken with a light meal or snack) was taken approximately 24 hours apart. Each dose of ZDV/3TC (taken with or without food) was taken approximately 12 hours apart.

measure.title: Multicenter AIDS Cohort Study (MACS) Participant Adherence to Regimen and Drug Components for ATV 300 mg / RTV 100 mg Test Dose
measure.description: The MACS was administered to evaluate participant adherence to each drug and the adherence to the regimen. The MACS adherence questionnaire asks patients how many medication doses they missed during the previous day, 2 days, 3 days and 4 days. Drug-specific questions included adherence with dose and frequency. Adherence was defined as taking all doses and numbers of pills as prescribed for each medication. This strict adherence cut-off was based on the guidelines stating that anything less than excellent adherence may result in a virus breakthrough and development of resistance.
measure.population: All treated participants were included in this evaluation.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
